On 4/3/07, Bradley, Todd <todd.bradley@...> wrote:

> > What is the=
 distinction between setup() and the constructor?
>
>  I'm not sure if this=
 is test runner specific behavior, but in my
>  experience the constructors=
 are all called at the same time, before any
>  tests are run.  And then se=
tUp() is run immediately before each test
>  method is executed.  That's wi=
th JUnit 3.8.  I can't speak for version 4
>  as we haven't switched yet.

=
Yes, but this doesn't answer Adrian's original question... (which I've
alwa=
ys found hard to answer as well).

Then again, I am in the camp of people w=
ho think that maintaining
immutable state in tests is not only harmless, it=
's actually very
useful.  Which is why TestNG will not reinstantiate your t=
est classes
like JUnit does.
